text: Anatol Mühlstein (22 August 1889 – 29 September 1957) was a Polish diplomat and writer. He served as Chargé d'affaires for the Polish embassy in Brussels in 1927, and as Minister Plenipotentiary for the Polish embassy in Paris 1930–36. Born to a Jewish family in Warsaw, he studied in Geneva, Paris, and Brussels. In 1932, Mühlstein married Diane de Rothschild, daughter of French banker Robert de Rothschild. The couple had three daughters: Nathalie, Anka, and Cecile. After the German invasion of France, Mühlstein moved to the United States. He returned to France after World War II. == References == == External links == * Biography at Internetowy Polski Słownik Biograficzny Category:1889 births Category:1957 deaths Category:Polish people of Jewish descent Category:Diplomats of the Second Polish Republic
title: Anatol Mühlstein
